meanings.definition: The process of deformation and movement of the Earth's crust.
meanings.sent1: Tectonism can cause mountains to form over time.
meanings.sent2: Geologists study tectonism to understand how the Earth's surface changes.
meanings.sent3: The playful rocks joked about tectonism, saying they were tired of being pushed around.
meanings.sent4: The tectonism of society can be seen in the shifting dynamics of relationships.
meanings.sent5: The relentless tectonism of the Earth shapes our landscapes in remarkable ways.

meanings.definition: The study of the structural features of the Earth's crust.
meanings.sent1: Understanding tectonism helps scientists map out the Earth's layers.
meanings.sent2: Tectonism involves analyzing the different layers that make up the Earth's crust.
meanings.sent3: The curious student eagerly delved into the world of tectonism to uncover hidden secrets.
meanings.sent4: In the intricate dance of tectonism, the Earth reveals its ancient history.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on tectonism vividly illustrated the complexities of the Earth's structure.

meanings.definition: The theory of large-scale movements and deformation of the Earth's lithosphere.
meanings.sent1: Scientists debate various aspects of tectonism to refine their understanding of Earth's processes.
meanings.sent2: Tectonism theory explains how continents drift over millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a skit on tectonism, portraying continents as quirky characters.
meanings.sent4: In the grand symphony of tectonism, continents collide and separate like dancers on a stage.
meanings.sent5: The concept of tectonism revolutionized our perception of the Earth's dynamic nature.
